infos.value: Lord Mont!
Serjes... What's the matter?
I believe that is my line.
Just where are you—
I heard from King Khury that Fennes is building a fortress just beyond the border.
A fortress... Then it must be in the province of Syckle where our territories meet.
They have attempted construction there numerous times in the past, but we have always impeded their plans.
It seems we must do so again...
I see. In that case, I must thwart them at all costs.
Huh!? Wait a moment, please!
Are you telling me...you've been ordered to subdue the Fennes forces!?
Not ordered. I volunteered.
But, why...? Your soldiers' wounds are still fresh. Moreover...
F-forgive my bluntness, but in your party's current state...
Our current state... I understand your concern.
Truly, I do. But I can't turn to Father or Schuzelt for help this time.
Then why would you agree to such—
King Khury is testing us. Or at least, that is what I believe.
He wants to see which country will best serve Wezette's interests—Fennes or Leonis.
We must prove our worth. If we don't, Wezette will abandon Leonis to fend for itself.
So we march. As long as there is a sliver of hope for victory.
...That gallantry must have been what charmed Lady Glaciela.
It's nothing like that. We're simply good friends.
Is that so?
I must be off, now. Keep Father and Schuzelt out of harm's way until our return.
Lord Mont... Though I can't be of help, perhaps «Rubeus» could...
«Rubeus»?
They are a group of honorable bandits at odds with Wezette.
You may be able to hire their muscle.
Even though they fight against Wezette?
They are devoted to Lady Glaciela. So perhaps...
I understand. Thank you, Serjes.
Their hideout is said to lie east of here. And please…return safely, Lord Mont.
